==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|げん|ざい|ち|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=けんざいち'|現在|tr1=genzai|t1=present, current|地|tr2=chi|t2=place, location}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|げ|んざ|いち}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɡẽ̞nza̠it͡ɕi]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|げんざいち}}

# present [[location]], current location
# "you are here" (on map)

====Usage notes====
A somewhat less common but still rather frequent variant or related phrase, {{l|ja|[[現在]][[位置]]|tr=[[げんざい]][[いち]], ''genzai ichi''||present location}} is also in use on maps serving the function of the English “you are here”.
